wikipedia_page.main: Sir Patrick Murray of Ochtertyre, 6th Baronet FRSE (3 February 1771–1 June 1837) was a Scottish advocate, landowner and politician, serving as MP for Edinburgh from 1806 to 1812 and Baron of the Exchequer in 1820. He is sometimes referred to as Sir Peter Murray.

response: * Lady Mary Anne Hope (died 21 February 1838) (married Patrick Murray of Ochtertyre)
Members of the Murray family living here included William Murray of Ochtertyre and his son Patrick Murray of Ochtertyre.
Hope-Johnstone's brothers-in-law included Charles Hope, Lord Granton, Henry Dundas, Viscount Melville and  Sir Patrick Murray of Ochtertyre.

He was born William Murray at Ochtertyre on 19 July 1801 the son of Patrick Murray of Ochtertyre and Lady Mary Anne Hope, daughter of John Hope, 2nd Earl of Hopetoun by his third wife.
